page_header.title: Our Curriculum
page_header.subtitle: A broad and balanced education for every child

overview.heading: Curriculum Overview
paragraphs: At Webitor Primary, we follow the National Curriculum while enriching it with exciting, creative opportunities that inspire our pupils to become lifelong learners. Our curriculum is carefully designed to build knowledge and skills progressively from Reception through to Year 6.
We believe in a knowledge-rich curriculum that develops children's understanding of the world while fostering creativity, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

subjects.title: English
subjects.description: We prioritize reading, writing, and spoken language. Our phonics programme ensures every child becomes a confident reader.

subjects.title: Mathematics
subjects.description: Using a mastery approach, children develop deep understanding of mathematical concepts and problem-solving skills.

subjects.title: Science
subjects.description: Hands-on investigations and experiments bring scientific concepts to life and nurture curiosity about the natural world.

subjects.title: Geography
subjects.description: Exploring the world's physical and human features, developing understanding of diverse places and cultures.

subjects.title: History
subjects.description: Bringing the past to life through engaging topics from Ancient Egypt to World War II.

subjects.title: Art & Design
subjects.description: Developing creativity and technical skills through drawing, painting, sculpture, and digital art.

subjects.title: Music
subjects.description: Learning to play instruments, sing, and appreciate music from different traditions and genres.

subjects.title: Computing
subjects.description: Developing digital literacy, coding skills, and understanding of online safety.

subjects.title: Physical Education
subjects.description: Building fitness, coordination, and teamwork through sports, gymnastics, and dance.

subjects.title: RE & PSHE
subjects.description: Understanding beliefs, values, and personal development including health and wellbeing.

subjects.title: Modern Languages
subjects.description: KS2 pupils learn French, developing language skills and cultural awareness.

reading.heading: Reading at Webitor
paragraphs: Reading is at the heart of our curriculum. We use a systematic phonics programme (Read Write Inc.) to teach early reading, ensuring all children develop strong decoding skills.
Every child has daily reading opportunities, and we encourage reading for pleasure through our well-stocked library, book corners in every classroom, and author visits.

reading_milestones.heading: Reading Milestones
reading_milestones.description: We celebrate reading achievement through our Bronze, Silver, and Gold reading awards. Children who read regularly at home and complete reading challenges earn certificates and prizes.

activities.title: Sports & Fitness
activities.description: Football, netball, athletics, gymnastics, and swimming clubs

activities.title: Performing Arts
activities.description: Drama, choir, school productions, and music lessons

activities.title: STEM Clubs
activities.description: Coding, robotics, science experiments, and maths challenges

activities.title: Creative Arts
activities.description: Art club, craft activities, and creative writing workshops

send.heading: Special Educational Needs
paragraphs: We are committed to ensuring that all children, regardless of their individual needs, receive the support they require to thrive. Our SENCO works closely with teachers, parents, and external agencies to provide tailored support for children with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND).
We offer a range of interventions including speech and language therapy, literacy and numeracy support, social skills groups, and sensory breaks.
